intro: Mammillaria intricata, commonly known as the Mexican beauty, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and compact size, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
